DataElement.preferredName: Assessment Canadian Cardiovascular Society Grading Scale Class CCSScaleCode
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Examination of the body by auscultation, palpation, percussion, inspection, and olfaction.  (Taber's)_A finding associated with a patient based on the functional classification developed by the Canadian Cardiovascular Society (CCS), for categorizing patients with angina. The classification system comprises four classes, which are defined in terms of the level of physical activity associated the with patient's anginal symptoms._The Canadian Cardiovascular Society Grading Scale for angina.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Assessment Canadian Cardiovascular Society Grading Scale Class
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Examination of the body by auscultation, palpation, percussion, inspection, and olfaction.  (Taber's)_A finding associated with a patient based on the functional classification developed by the Canadian Cardiovascular Society (CCS), for categorizing patients with angina. The classification system comprises four classes, which are defined in terms of the level of physical activity associated the with patient's anginal symptoms.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Examination of the body by auscultation, palpation, percussion, inspection, and olfaction.  (Taber's)

Concepts.definition: A systemic evaluation of the body and its functions using visual inspection, palpation, percussion and auscultation. The purpose is to determine the presence or absence of physical signs of disease or abnormality for an individual's health assessment.

Property.preferredName: Canadian Cardiovascular Society Grading Scale Class
Property.preferredDefinition: A finding associated with a patient based on the functional classification developed by the Canadian Cardiovascular Society (CCS), for categorizing patients with angina. The classification system comprises four classes, which are defined in terms of the level of physical activity associated the with patient's anginal symptoms.

Concepts.longName: CCS Grading of Angina Pectoris - Grade
Concepts.definition: Canadian Cardiovascular Society Grading of Angina Pectoris (CCS Grading of Angina Pectoris) Grade.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 12/7/08 - released per Emily Honeycutt/Duke Clinical Research Institute

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The Canadian Cardiovascular Society Grading Scale for angina.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A position on a scale of intensity or amount or quality.:No person or thing, nobody, not any.

Concepts.definition: A position on a scale of intensity or amount or quality.
No person or thing, nobody, not any.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Canadian Cardiovascular Society Grading Scale Class I

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Canadian Cardiovascular Society Grading Scale Class I
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A grading of angina such that ordinary physical activity, such as walking or climbing stairs, does not cause angina. Angina occurs with strenuous, rapid, or prolonged exertion at work or recreation.

Concepts.longName: Canadian Cardiovascular Society Grading of Angina Pectoris CCSGA101 Standardized Character Result Grade I
Concepts.definition: Canadian Cardiovascular Society Grading of Angina Pectoris CCSGA101 Standardized Character Result Grade I - Grade I: Ordinary physical activity does not cause angina, such as walking and climbing stairs. Angina with strenuous or rapid or prolonged exertion at work or recreation.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Canadian Cardiovascular Society Grading Scale Class II

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Canadian Cardiovascular Society Grading Scale Class II
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A grading of angina characterized by a slight limitation of ordinary activity. Angina occurs on walking or climbing stairs rapidly, walking uphill, walking or climbing stairs after meals, or in cold, in wind, or under emotional stress, or only during the few hours after awakening. Angina occurs on walking more than 2 blocks on the level and climbing more than 1 flight of ordinary stairs at a normal pace and in normal condition.

Concepts.longName: Canadian Cardiovascular Society Grading of Angina Pectoris CCSGA101 Standardized Character Result Grade II
Concepts.definition: Canadian Cardiovascular Society Grading of Angina Pectoris CCSGA101 Standardized Character Result Grade II - Grade II: Slight limitation of ordinary activity. Walking or climbing stairs rapidly, walking uphill, walking or stair climbing after meals, or in cold, or in wind, or under emotional stress, or only during the few hours after awakening. Walking more than two blocks on the level and climbing more than one flight of ordinary stairs at a normal pace and in normal conditions.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Canadian Cardiovascular Society Grading Scale Class III

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Canadian Cardiovascular Society Grading Scale Class III
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A grading of angina characterized by marked limitations of ordinary physical activity. Angina occurs on walking 1 to 2 blocks on the level and climbing 1 flight of stairs in normal conditions and at a normal pace.

Concepts.longName: Canadian Cardiovascular Society Grading of Angina Pectoris CCSGA101 Standardized Character Result Grade III
Concepts.definition: Canadian Cardiovascular Society Grading of Angina Pectoris CCSGA101 Standardized Character Result Grade III - Grade III: Marked limitation of ordinary physical activity. Walking one or two blocks on the level and climbing one flight of stairs in normal conditions and at normal pace.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Canadian Cardiovascular Society Grading Scale Class IV

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Canadian Cardiovascular Society Grading Scale Class IV
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A grading of angina characterized by an inability to perform any physical activity without discomfort; anginal symptoms may be present at rest.

Concepts.longName: Canadian Cardiovascular Society Grading of Angina Pectoris CCSGA101 Standardized Character Result Grade IV
Concepts.definition: Canadian Cardiovascular Society Grading of Angina Pectoris CCSGA101 Standardized Character Result Grade IV - Grade IV: Inability to carry on any physical activity without discomfort, anginal syndrome may be present at rest.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

Concepts.definition: A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.
